title: 110_hr1944
content: The Act titled "Veterans Traumatic Brain Injury Treatment Act of 2007" amends Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, by adding a new subchapter for screening, rehabilitation, and treatment for traumatic brain injury. The Act "Veterans Traumatic Brain Injury Treatment Act of 2007" establishes a screening program for eligible veterans to screen for symptoms of traumatic brain injury. The Secretary must submit an annual report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the number of veterans screened. The Act "Veterans Traumatic Brain Injury Treatment Act of 2007" establishes a screening program for eligible veterans to screen for symptoms of traumatic brain injury. The Secretary must submit an annual report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the number of veterans screened and the prevalence of traumatic brain injury symptoms among them. Recommendations for improving care and services to veterans with traumatic brain injury symptoms are also included. Additionally, a comprehensive program for long-term traumatic brain injury rehabilitation is to be developed by the Secretary, which includes residential, community, and home-based components utilizing interdisciplinary treatment teams. The Secretary will implement a program at four polytrauma network sites for eligible veterans who served in combat operations after the Persian Gulf War. The Secretary will implement a program for eligible veterans who served in combat operations after the Persian Gulf War and are diagnosed with moderate to severe traumatic brain injury, unable to manage daily activities without assistance. The Secretary is required to submit an annual report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding this program. The House of Representatives requires a report on a program providing care to veterans with traumatic brain injuries, including the program's operation, number of veterans served, and annual cost. Additionally, the Secretary must establish traumatic brain injury transition offices at Department polytrauma network sites to coordinate healthcare and services for veterans with moderate to severe traumatic brain injuries. The Secretary can arrange health-care and services through cooperative agreements for veterans with traumatic brain injuries. A Traumatic Brain Injury Veterans' Health Registry will be established and maintained by the Secretary. The Registry, established by the Secretary, will list individuals from Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom with traumatic brain injury symptoms seeking care or filing compensation claims. The Registry may include relevant medical data and other information with permission from the individual or if the individual is deceased. The Secretary will notify individuals listed in the Registry of significant developments in research on health. Subchapter IX of title 38, United States Code, addresses traumatic brain injury. It includes screening, a comprehensive rehabilitation program, transition offices, and a registry. The Secretary must implement these requirements within 180 days of the enactment of the Act.
